content:
Steve Howell said:

For the stream and settings panels, I am actually anti-modal--for them, I would just have them take over the entire browser window. It seems like having the stuff in the background just wastes valuable real estate. And then you would just need a really obvious way to exit them.

Wow, that's an unexpected perspective... and my knee jerk reaction would be against something like that.
But that actually makes a lot of sense.
wow. Also this is kinda how discord does it.
My major concern would be that this would make stream subscription too complex for Zulip beginners...
Then gmail takes over the pane for settings, which looks kinda ugly to me.

Yash RE said:

My major concern would be that this would make stream subscription too complex for Zulip beginners...

Why?

Steve Howell said:

Why?

Because it just feels easier to exit/undo/get away from a modal.

What Slack does here is take over the middle and right panes, and they leave the left sidebar. Which is pretty reasonable. I think helping-folks-find-their-way-back is a solvable problem when you're editing settings. But I also agree that "it just feels easier to exit/undo/get away from a modal" makes sense in some circumstances, too, including this one. For me the big tradeoff here, which doesn't apply in every situation, is screen real estate. I just hate how cramped our settings get for editing streams.
lol, I was just typing something about that, gimme a sec

This, to me, feels like a lot of wasted real estate, to make it easier to leave the modal:

image.png

Yash RE said:

But that actually makes a lot of sense.

One of the issues with the stream settings modal is that it just doesn't have enough space to do everything it's trying to achieve. The right side of the stream config has bit of a vertical scroll and the subscriber list within that right panel has a vertical scroll. That's bad.
Apart from this, as we add more and more stream specific features. It's only going to get worse. I wanted to push for stream specific default markdown languages and hesitated because I thought: "we might not have space for this setting". Which is bad.

But look how wisely we use the space in the left pane. </sarcasm>

image.png
(My screenshot is a little unfair, as our dev data doesn't bother with long descriptions, which normally take up some of that white space.)
All I want to say is, I'm super in favor of making this differently.
hmmmmmm
how about this:

we have a single panel modal, so that subscribe/unsubscribe/see basic info is easy access.
But then if you select a stream, it shifts to a full page with all the settings. (and doesn't shift back unless you exit the view via eg a big cross mark)
I agree with the overall direction of what you're proposing, but it's a huge no-no to go from a modal to a different full screen.
Yeah..

Despite what I said about modals earlier, I'm fine with keeping "Manage Streams" in a modal. I just don't think the split-pane buys us anything. When you're in the left pane, the right pane is only showing details for one stream, when those details are mostly either a) already in the left panel, or b) easily represented as icons in the left pane, or c) offscreen anyway.

And then when you're looking at the right pane, the left pane is 100% useless. I mean, it's just pure noise.
but then, it's probably the best / most convenient way to switch between the stream who's setting you're looking at. We really should prototype new layouts/views and and transitions.
I'll try and make something and share soon. (also, made a separate topic).
Wow, that "said" is a really useful way to mark where the digression is from. (ie we came here from #design > searching for a topic)
